txt.en: You see Surâsh tied up near the front gate!
You were discovered by a look-out
Agree to deliver the message to Mizâdi.
Listen to Bârshud's message to Mizâdi.
Flee the tent and find Surâsh.
Ascend the stairs to find the other prisoners
Free Surâsh near the front gate.
Flee the camp!
Working with Nimasi, you have traced the banner attacks to a large camp in southern Imhûlar. Investigate the camp without being seen to discover the source of these attacks.
Speak with Razâl inside the Angar Aragín.
You see Surâsh tied up near the front gate. Free her!
'If you were any easier to fool, you'd be a goat. Shâr Bârshud II, the Great Healer, here is Mizâdi's hound, delivered as promised.'
Speak with Razâl inside the Angar Aragín
You feel a hard weight strike your head, and then darkness finds you
'None at all. I play dumb, and somehow, it works every time.'
'Tell her war is coming to her.'
'Mizâdi claims the same, milord.'
'I have thousands of Ordâkhai at my disposal, warriors of the Hûl himself, all ready to tear apart her ragtag band.'
'She thinks she is Hamât?'
'I am Hamât, and I don't lose.'
'Tell her she can surrender, or I will flay the flesh from the bones of every man, woman and child in Kûr Anzar.'
'Tell her war is coming, and she is not ready.'
'Now go, before I let my Umûni have their fun.'
'Nimasi, free them.'
Agree to deliver Bârshud's message to Mizâdi
'Run.'
Listen to Bârshud's message to Mizâdi
Flee the tent and find Surâsh before Bârshud changes his mind
'You do not belong here!'
Free Surâsh near the front gate
'You'll make a fine gift for Barshûd!'
Flee the camp
'You never should have come here.'
'Barshûd will decide your fate!'
<rgb=#ff0000>Avoid Ekhamâti Look-outs</rgb>
Listen to Nisami
'Good work, Nimasi. I trust there was no trouble bringing the dog to us?'

'There's no telling what we may find here. I believe they bring the sacrifices upstairs to one of their dark altars. That is likely where we'll find Numûru and any other unfortunates they've gathered.'
'Yes, somehow.'
'Do you know who I am, dog? I am descended from the line of kings of Hamât, from Aragín the Queller himself.'
Move to the main tent inside the camp\n\n<rgb=#ff0000>Avoid Ekhamâti Look-outs</rgb>
'That child thinks she is descended from Aragín, that his royal blood flows through her? I didn't know you told jokes, Nimasi. You should stick to bringing in strays.'
'Now I could kill you, or I could leave you for my Umûni. Each would love a bit of sport, the pleasure of carving your skin. What a marvellous canvas you have. Barely a scratch on it.'
Listen to the large man standing in front of you
'But that's not why you're here, is it?'
'You're here to deliver a message to that impertinent child in Kûr Anzar.'
'Yes, I know about her recent victory. Okhíso was always a fool, and only a fool could let a child trap and kill him in his own city.'
Speak with Nimasi in the tent
'Listen closely.'
'Let us go. Swiftly!'
Listen to the large man standing in the centre of the tent.
Move to the main tent to determine who is leading this force of Ordâkhai.
As you leave the camp behind, you hear peals of sharp laughter echoing behind you
Listen to Nimasi in the tent.
Instance: Schemes and Misadventures
You were discovered by a lookout
'If you were any easier to fool, you'd be a goat.\n\n'Shâr Bârshud II, the Great Healer, here is Mizâdi's hound, delivered as promised.'
